etymology.description: 弓(弓) (gōng, "bow") + 矢(矢) (shǐ, "arrow") -> shooting action depicted -> hand 又(又) (yòu, "hand") added in bronze inscriptions -> later 又 changed to 寸(寸) (cùn, "inch") -> bow and arrow stylized as 身(身) (shēn, "body")
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted the action of shooting a bow and arrow, with a hand drawing the bowstring added in later script forms. Over time, the hand was simplified, and the bow and arrow merged into the form of a body, reflecting the dynamic motion of shooting.

examples.chinese: 弓箭手射中目标(弓箭手射中目標)。
小明拉开弓(小明拉開弓)，射出一支箭(射出一支箭)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎomíng lā kāi gōng, shè chū yī zhī jiàn.
examples.english: Xiaoming drew his bow and shot an arrow.

examples.chinese: 猎人在森林中设下埋伏(獵人在森林中設下埋伏)，射向敌人(射向敵人)。
examples.pinyin: Lièrén zài sēnlín zhōng shè xià máifú, shè xiàng dírén.
examples.english: The hunter laid an ambush in the forest and shot at the enemy.
